intro: Kyllinga bifolia, commonly known as the two-leaved spikerush, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often near water bodies. Its appearance includes slender stems with two distinct leaf-like structures, giving it its common name. Kyllinga bifolia is characterized by its small, spike-like inflorescences that produce numerous tiny flowers.
